meanings.definition: To deduce or conclude from evidence or reasoning.
meanings.sent1: I can infer from the footprints that a dog was here.
meanings.sent2: She could infer from the dark clouds that it might rain soon.
meanings.sent3: He tried to infer from the messy room that a tornado had passed through.
meanings.sent4: The detective could infer from the fingerprints who the culprit was.
meanings.sent5: By the look on her face, I could infer that she was upset.

meanings.definition: To guess or speculate based on available information.
meanings.sent1: Based on the empty cookie jar, I can infer that my brother ate all the cookies.
meanings.sent2: She will infer from the closed blinds that her roommate is still sleeping.
meanings.sent3: I infer from the loud music that there must be a party next door.
meanings.sent4: The teacher could infer from the unfinished homework that the students had a busy weekend.
meanings.sent5: From the long line outside the store, I could infer that they were having a sale.
